parameters.name: project_number
parameters.description: The bo.om internal 8 digit long project number. Will never change over the lifetime of a project and starts with the two last digits of the year the project was created in.

parameters.name: authority_project_number
parameters.description: The client's specific project number. May be up to 50 characters long. Defaults to the bo.om project number if none was given.

200.description: One or more projects were found

data.description: array with one *or more* unique projects, ordered by ascending project id

post.summary: Create and send a project initialization document in the given project.
Create a new appointment for the given project.
post.description: The organizing authority will be the current API authenticated authority. The RequestingUser will be automatically participating. Currently, all users having a role in the project will be invited to participate.

get.summary: Fetch information about a single appointment

post.summary: Update a user's participation to the appointment.
post.description: This will trigger calendar integration updates for participating users via email, too.
This will trigger calendar integration updates for participating users via email, too.
Service determinations created with this endpoint will **not** contain the positions from previously sent service determinations
Service determinations created with this endpoint **will** contain the positions from previously sent service determinations

get.summary: Search offers by project ID or external reference key of offers. Results are limited to the 10 most recent offers

parameters.name: external_reference_key
parameters.description: The external reference that was given on offer creation to identify the offer based on data persisted by the API consumer (usually the primary key in the database of the consumer)

200.description: One or more offers were found

offers.description: array with between 0 and 10 unique offers, ordered by descending id (newest first)

post.summary: Create a offer request, requesting changes of an offer
Upload and attach a file to a project or a document (limited number of documents supported)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: What type of file is uploaded (in the bo.om context, not file type!)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
if {type} is
  * "inspection", this must be the document ID of an inspection document

file.description: base64 encoded file to be uploaded

file_name.description: file name with the file type

post.summary: Create an order from the given sent offer

parameters.name: offerId
parameters.description: bo.om ID of a sent offer

post.summary: Create an order from the last sent offer in the given project

post.description: This template governs the available rooms and rough services per room that can be selected in a service determination document (see `/service-determinations/add` and `/service-determinations/create`) and must adhere to a specific format. For more information see the example request for a minimal but working template or ask your bo.om contact person.

file.description: base64 encoded file to be uploaded

project_number.description: The bo.om internal 8 digit long project number. Will never change over the lifetime of a project and starts with the two last digits of the year the project was created in.

authority_project_number.description: The client's specific project number. May be up to 50 characters long. Defaults to the bo.om project number if none was given.

project_status.description: The project status for this organization. Defaults to 'active', but a organization might decide to archive a project, mainly for housekeeping purposes. The other organization (contractor) will not be affected by nor notified of this change.

The project status for this organization. Defaults to 'active', but a organization might decide to archive a project, mainly for housekeeping purposes. The other organization (purchaser) will not be affected by nor notified of this change.

project_id.description: The project in which to create the document

Customer.description: Represents a housing association inside bo.om, internally referred to as 'customer'.

type.description:
Defines the scope of the renovation:
 * `first_inspection` - Erstbegehung
 * `interim_inspection` - Zwischenbesichtigung
 * `end_inspection` - Abnahme

description.example: Let's meet on the other side of the street!

allOf.description: The organizer authority of this appointment

authority_project_number.description: The client's internal project identifier for later referencing

RequestingUser.description: The user requesting the action. Depending on configuration, this user will be created before executing the requested action, if the user does not yet exist. Audit Logs will reference the given user as the executor of the action.

AdditionalDocumentData.description: Unstructured additional data, any type of value or nest-level is accepted, `null` as well.

allOf.description: The authority this user belongs to

DocumentBasicInformationModel.description: Defines a number of general information fields every document has like it's unique number or status

status.description: Whether the document is still in draft mode or already sent

substatus.description: Additional status a *sent* document can be in, depending on the document type. Most documents can be "archived", meaning this document is superseded by a newer version of the same type

number.description: A generated unique document number, starting with the last two digits of the year the document was created in

origin_document_id.description: The ID of the document this document is based on, for example an order is always based on a sent offer, which would be referenced in this field

ProjectBasicInformationModel.description: Defines a number of general information fields about the project, used by the 2 initialization documents (ProjectInitialization and ServiceDetermination), but also used for general project information as the project contains the newest version of these informations provided by the initialization documents.

start.description: The desired start date of the project

end.description: The desired end date of the project

cost_limit.description: The cost limit for the project. Float, formatted as a string.

additional_info_technical.description: Additional notes related to the technical part of the project

additional_info_planning.description: Additional notes related to the planning part of the project
additional_info_planning.example: Montags darf hier nicht gearbeitet werden

object_access.description: Defines how the object can be accessed

object_access_notes.description: Additional notes about the object access

hazardous_substances_notes.description: Additional notes about the hazardous substances

e_check.description: Information about E-Check to be performed

scope_of_renovation.description:
Defines the scope of the renovation:
 * `half` - Teilsanierung
 * `full` - Vollsanierung
 * `maintenance` - Instandhaltung

floor_plan_changes.description: Information about E-Check to be performed

floor_plan_changes_notes.description: Additional notes about floor plan changes

valid_until.description: How long this offer is valid

terms_comments.description: A concatenated string of all terms comments added to the document by various involved users
terms_comments.example:
Anmerkung von Markus Leiter, B&O Gruppe:
Anmerkung test

Anmerkung von Boom Kunde, WohnungsBauGesellschaft:
Ja, das ist allerdings richtig

id.description: Any ID from the first column of the uploaded service determination template (see /service-determinations/upload-template)

room.description: This room name *has* to be present in the first row of the last uploaded service determination template (see /service-determinations/upload-template).

comment.description: Free text comment for this position
comment.example: Maybe this lamp is still good, decide for yourself

crafts.description: A deeply nested object with the selected crafts, categories and then positions. Content of this fully depends on the used service determination template.

parent_document_position_id.description: The parent document position ID, usually this is a module ID (see belongs_to_module flag)

gross_price_single.description: Net price for a single item (`net_price_single`) multiplied with the default vat rate of the customers country (`applied_vat_rate`)

applied_vat_rate.description: The applied vat rate used for calculating gross_price_single, expressed as per cent ("20% vat rate" => applied_vat_rate = 20)

allOf.description: The service from the service catalog the position is based on

id.description: The ID of the attachments entity

model.description: What type of entity the attachment belongs to

foreign_key.description: The ID of the entity the attachment belongs to, which might be an unsigned int32 or a UUID

global_positions_comment.description: A comment that is additionally appended to every position comment

property1.validationRule1: Field 'property1' does not comply with validation 'validationRule1'

property2.validationRule1: Field 'property2' does not comply with validation 'validationRule1'
property2.validationRule2: Field 'property2' does not comply with validation 'validationRule2'

message.description: Human readable error message. Consumers of this API should not rely on the contents of this string but rather check for the `code` or the HTTP status code.

authority_project_number.description: The client's internal project identifier for later referencing

type.description:
Defines the scope of the renovation:
 * `first_inspection` - Erstbegehung
 * `interim_inspection` - Zwischenbesichtigung
 * `end_inspection` - Abnahme

description.example: Let's meet on the other side of the street!

MinimalSuccess.description: Everything went fine, but we have nothing to respond with

AppointmentSuccess.description: The full appointment after save/update operation

OfferRequestSuccess.description: The full offer request after save

404NotFound.description: A referenced resource was not found.

message.description: Human readable error message. Consumers of this API should not rely on the contents of this string but rather check for the `code` which is the same as the HTTP status code.

400BadRequest.description:
A validation error occurred while trying to save the resource. This could either be the schema of the data or the data itself being invalid:
* If the schema of the request body was invalid, a human readable message in the response body under 'message' will say so.
* If the given data were invalid, the response body will under 'code' contain the string 'validation_failed' and under 'data' a list of fields, each with a list of validation errors, that triggered the error. See below for an abstract example of that case:

property1.min_length: Field 'property1' must be at least 10 characters long
